isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - REMOVE - CHECKING THE BACKLASH OF THE RING GEAR

svcproc.title: CHECKING THE BACKLASH OF THE RING GEAR
svcproc.para: Check the backlash at three places on the ring gear.

note.para: Unless a new ring gear and drive pinion are installed, the backlash of the ring gear must be checked and recorded before the carrier is disassembled. The backlash reading is necessary for the correct reassembly of the ring gear and the drive pinion.

step1.para: Turn the carrier so that the ring gear is toward you.

Install a dial indicator on the flange of the carrier. Put the tip of the indicator against the "drive" side of a tooth on the ring gear. Adjust the dial indicator to the "zero" (0) setting ( Figure 26).

figure.caption: Figure 26. Adjust Dial Indicator to Zero

note.para: When you rotate the ring gear to measure the backlash, make sure the drive pinion does not move.

step1.para: Look at the dial indicator and slightly rotate the ring gear in both directions. Record the reading on the dial indicator. The maximum ring gear runout is 0.008 inch (.20 mm).
